label: Phylogenetic tree annotation
description: Annotate a phylogenetic tree with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

label: Protein structure comparison
description: Compare protein tertiary structures.|Methods might identify structural neighbors, find structural similarities or define a structural core.

label: Sequence tag mapping
description: Make sequence tag to gene assignments (tag mapping) of SAGE, MPSS and SBS data.|Sequence tag mapping assigns experimentally obtained sequence tags to known transcripts or annotate potential virtual sequence tags in a genome.

label: Variant pattern analysis
description: Identify and map patterns of genomic variations.|Methods often utilise a database of aligned reads.

label: Protein fragment weight comparison
description: Calculate the molecular weight of a protein (or fragments) and compare it to another protein or reference data. Generally used for protein identification.

label: Codon usage table comparison
description: Compare two or more codon usage tables.

label: Gene expression comparison
description: Comparison of gene expression profiles.

label: Pathway or network visualisation
description: Render (visualise) a biological pathway or network.

label: Genome comparison
description: Compare the sequence or features of two or more genomes, for example, to find matching regions.

label: Collapsing methods
description: A method whereby data on several variants are "collapsed" into a single covariate based on regions such as genes.|Genome-wide association studies (GWAS) analyse a genome-wide set of genetic variants in different individuals to see if any variant is associated with a trait. Traditional association techniques can lack the power to detect the significance of rare variants individually, or measure their compound effect (rare variant burden).  "Collapsing methods" were developed to overcome these problems.

label: Standardisation and normalisation
description: Standardize or normalize data by some statistical method.| In the simplest normalisation means adjusting values measured on different scales to a common scale (often between 0.0 and 1.0), but can refer to more sophisticated adjustment whereby entire probability distributions of adjusted values are brought into alignment. Standardisation typically refers to an operation whereby a range of values are standardised to measure how many standard deviations a value is from its mean.

label: DNA vaccine design
description: Predict or optimise DNA to elicit (via DNA vaccination) an immunological response.

label: Exonic splicing enhancer prediction
description: Identify or predict exonic splicing enhancers (ESE) in exons.|An exonic splicing enhancer (ESE) is 6-base DNA sequence motif in an exon that enhances or directs splicing of pre-mRNA or hetero-nuclear RNA (hnRNA) into mRNA.

label: Protein hydrophobic region calculation
description: Calculate hydrophobic or hydrophilic / charged regions of a protein sequence.

label: Statistical inference
description: Analyse data in order to deduce properties of an underlying distribution or population.

label: Residue bump detection
description: Detect 'bumps' between residues in a structure, i.e. those with pairs of atoms whose Van der Waals' radii interpenetrate more than a defined distance.

label: Codon usage analysis
description: Process (read and / or write) codon usage data, e.g. analyse codon usage tables or codon usage in molecular sequences.

label: Protein aliphatic index calculation
description: Calculate aliphatic index (relative volume occupied by aliphatic side chains) of a protein.

label: Ontology visualisation
description: Visualise, format or render data from an ontology, typically a tree of terms.

label: Validation
description: Validate some data.

label: Ramachandran plot calculation
description: Calculate a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.

label: Prediction and recognition
description: Predict, recognise, detect or identify some properties of a biomolecule.

label: Ontology comparison
description: Compare two or more ontologies, e.g. identify differences.

label: Random sequence generation
description: Generate a random sequence, for example, with a specific character composition.

label: Mapping
description: Map properties to positions on an biological entity (typically a molecular sequence or structure), or assemble such an entity from constituent parts.

label: Primer removal
description: Remove forward and/or reverse primers from nucleic acid sequences (typically PCR products).

label: Phylogenetic tree generation (AI methods)
description: Construct a phylogenetic tree by using artificial-intelligence methods, for example genetic algorithms.

label: Diffraction data reduction
description: Processing of diffraction data into a corrected, ordered, and simplified form.

label: Protein threading
description: Align molecular sequence to structure in 3D space (threading).|Use this concept for methods that evaluate sequence-structure compatibility by assessing residue interactions in 3D. Methods might perform one-to-one, one-to-many or many-to-many comparisons.

label: Bibliography generation
description: Construct a bibliography from the scientific literature.

label: CpG island and isochore detection
description: Find CpG rich regions in a nucleotide sequence or isochores in genome sequences.|An isochore is long region (> 3 KB) of DNA with very uniform GC content, in contrast to the rest of the genome. Isochores tend tends to have more genes, higher local melting or denaturation temperatures, and different flexibility. Methods might calculate fractional GC content or variation of GC content, predict methylation status of CpG islands etc. This includes methods that visualise CpG rich regions in a nucleotide sequence, for example plot isochores in a genome sequence.

label: Protein structure prediction
description: Predict tertiary structure (backbone and side-chain conformation) of protein sequences.

label: Maximum occurence analysis
description: A method for making numerical assessments about the maximum percent of time that a conformer of a flexible macromolecule can exist and still be compatible with the experimental data.

label: Sequence tagged site (STS) mapping
description: Generate a physical DNA map (sequence map) from analysis of sequence tagged sites (STS).|An STS is a short subsequence of known sequence and location that occurs only once in the chromosome or genome that is being mapped. Sources of STSs include 1. expressed sequence tags (ESTs), simple sequence length polymorphisms (SSLPs), and random genomic sequences from cloned genomic DNA or database sequences.

label: SECIS element prediction
description: Predict selenocysteine insertion sequence (SECIS) in a DNA sequence.|SECIS elements are around 60 nucleotides in length with a stem-loop structure directs the cell to translate UGA codons as selenocysteines.

label: Incident curve plotting
description: Plot an incident curve such as a survival curve, death curve, mortality curve.

label: Sequence composition calculation
description: Calculate character or word composition or frequency of a molecular sequence.

label: DNA mapping
description: Generate a map of a DNA sequence annotated with positional or non-positional features of some type.

label: Sequence assembly validation
description: Evaluate a DNA sequence assembly, typically for purposes of quality control.

label: Free cysteine detection
description: Detect free cysteines in a protein structure.|A free cysteine is neither involved in a cysteine bridge, nor functions as a ligand to a metal.

label: Localised reassembly
description: Reconstruction of a sequence assembly in a localised area.

label: Comparison
description: Compare two or more things to identify similarities.

label: EST assembly
description: Sequence assembly for EST sequences (transcribed mRNA).|Assemblers must handle (or be complicated by) alternative splicing, trans-splicing, single-nucleotide polymorphism (SNP), recoding, and post-transcriptional modification.

label: Anonymisation
description: Process data in such a way that makes it hard to trace to the person which the data concerns.

label: Protein comparison
description: Compare two or more proteins (or some aspect) to identify similarities.

label: Protein modelling (mutation)
description: Predict the effect of point mutation on a protein structure, in terms of strucural effects and protein folding, stability and function.|This includes 1) rotamer likelihood prediction: the prediction of rotamer likelihoods for all 20 amino acid types at each position in a protein structure, where output typically includes, for each residue position, the likelihoods for the 20 amino acid types with estimated reliability of the 20 likelihoods.  2) Protein SNP mapping, which maps and modesl the effects of single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) on protein structure(s).  Methods might predict silent or pathological mutations.

label: Protein fold recognition
description: Recognize (predict and identify) known protein structural domains or folds in protein sequence(s) which (typically) are not accompanied by any significant sequence similarity to know structures.|Methods use some type of mapping between sequence and fold, for example secondary structure prediction and alignment, profile comparison, sequence properties, homologous sequence search, kernel machines etc. Domains and folds might be taken from SCOP or CATH.

label: Map drawing
description: Draw or visualise a DNA map.

label: Alignment
description: Compare two or more entities, typically the sequence or structure (or derivatives) of macromolecules, to identify equivalent subunits.

label: Representative sequence identification
description: Identify a representative sequence from a set of sequences, typically using scores from pair-wise alignment or other comparison of the sequences.

label: PolyA signal detection
description: Detect polyA signals in nucleotide sequences.

label: Helical wheel drawing
description: Render a helical wheel representation of protein secondary structure.

label: Enrichment analysis
description: Analysis of a set of objects, such as genes, annotated with given categories, where eventual over-/under-representation of certain categories within the studied set of objects is revealed.|Categories from a relevant ontology can be used. The input is typically a set of genes or other biological objects, possibly represented by their identifiers, and the output of the analysis is typically a ranked list of categories, each associated with a statistical metric of over-/under-representation within the studied data.

label: Document similarity calculation
description: Calculate similarity between 2 or more documents.

label: Data retrieval
description: Retrieve an entry (or part of an entry) from a data resource that matches a supplied query. This might include some primary data and annotation. The query is a data identifier or other indexed term. For example, retrieve a sequence record with the specified accession number, or matching supplied keywords.

label: Format detection
description: Recognition of which format the given data is in.|'Format recognition' is not a bioinformatics-specific operation, but of great relevance in bioinformatics. Should be removed from EDAM if/when captured satisfactorily in a suitable domain-generic ontology.

label: Gene regulatory network analysis
description: Analyse a known network of gene regulation.

label: Tag-based peptide identification
description: Peptide sequence tags are used as piece of information about a peptide obtained by tandem mass spectrometry.

label: RNA structure covariance model generation
description: Compute the covariance model for (a family of) RNA secondary structures.

label: Residue interaction calculation
description: Calculate or extract inter-atomic, inter-residue or residue-atom contacts, distances and interactions in protein structure(s).

label: Differential protein expression analysis
description: The analysis, using proteomics techniques, to identify proteins whose encoding genes are differentially expressed under a given experimental setup.

label: Methylation analysis
description: Determine cytosine methylation states in nucleic acid sequences.

label: Protein peeling
description: Decompose a structure into compact or globular fragments (protein peeling).

label: Nucleosome formation or exclusion sequence prediction
description: Identify or predict nucleosome exclusion sequences (nucleosome free regions) in DNA.

label: Protein-metal contact calculation
description: Calculate protein residue contacts with metal in a structure.

label: Blind peptide database search
description: Peptide database search for identification of known and unknown PTMs looking for mass difference mismatches.

label: Protein model validation
description: Evaluate the quality or correctness a protein three-dimensional model.|This includes methods that calculate poor quality residues. The scoring function to identify poor quality residues may consider residues with bad atoms or atoms with high B-factor, residues in the N- or C-terminal position, adjacent to an unstructured residue, non-canonical residues, glycine and proline (or adjacent to these such residues).|Model validation might involve checks for atomic packing, steric clashes (bumps), volume irregularities, agreement with electron density maps, number of amino acid residues, percentage of residues with missing or bad atoms, irregular Ramachandran Z-scores, irregular Chi-1 / Chi-2 normality scores, RMS-Z score on bonds and angles etc.|The PDB file format has had difficulties, inconsistencies and errors. Corrections can include identifying a meaningful sequence, removal of alternate atoms, correction of nomenclature problems, removal of incomplete residues and spurious waters, addition or removal of water, modelling of missing side chains, optimisation of cysteine bonds, regularisation of bond lengths, bond angles and planarities etc.

label: Service invocation
description: An operation supporting the calling (invocation) of other tools and services.

label: Restriction site creation
description: Create (or remove) restriction sites in sequences, for example using silent mutations.

label: Nucleic acid structure prediction
description: Predict structure of DNA or RNA.|Methods might identify thermodynamically stable or evolutionarily conserved structures.

label: Physical mapping
description: Generate a physical (sequence) map of a DNA sequence showing the physical distance (base pairs) between features or landmarks such as restriction sites, cloned DNA fragments, genes and other genetic markers.

label: Modelling and simulation
description: Model or simulate some biological entity or system, typically using mathematical techniques including  dynamical systems, statistical models, differential equations, and game theoretic models.

label: miRNA expression analysis
description: The analysis of microRNAs (miRNAs) : short, highly conserved small noncoding RNA molecules that are naturally occurring plant and animal genomes.

label: RNA-seq read count analysis
description: Analyze read counts from RNA-seq experiments.

label: Protein molecular weight calculation
description: Calculate the molecular weight of a protein sequence or fragments.

label: TMT-tag
description: Quantification analysis using the Thermo Fisher tandem mass tag labelling workflow.

label: Ab initio structure prediction
description: Predict tertiary structure of protein sequence(s) without homologs of known structure.

label: Phylogenetic footprinting / shadowing
description: Infer a phylogenetic tree by comparing orthologous sequences in different species, particularly many closely related species (phylogenetic shadowing).|A phylogenetic 'shadow' represents the additive differences between individual sequences. By masking or 'shadowing' variable positions a conserved sequence is produced with few or none of the variations, which is then compared to the sequences of interest to identify significant regions of conservation.

label: Sequence generation (nucleic acid)
description: Generate a nucleic acid sequence by some means.

label: Clustering profile plotting
description: Visualise clustered quantitative data as set of different profiles, where each profile is plotted versus different entities or samples on the X-axis.

label: Genome assembly
description: The process of assembling many short DNA sequences together such thay they represent the original chromosomes from which the DNA originated.

label: Natural product identification
description: Mass spectra identification of compounds that are produced by living systems. Including polyketides, terpenoids, phenylpropanoids, alkaloids and antibiotics.

label: Sequence classification
description: Assign molecular sequence(s) to a group or category.

label: Sequence clustering
description: Build clusters of similar sequences, typically using scores from pair-wise alignment or other comparison of the sequences.|The clusters may be output or used internally for some other purpose.

label: Residue packing validation
description: Identify poorly packed residues in protein structures.

label: Gene to pathway mapping
description: Map a gene expression profile to known biological pathways, for example, to identify or reconstruct a pathway.

label: Cysteine bridge detection
description: Detect cysteine bridges (from coordinate data) in a protein structure.

label: Cross-assembly
description: Construction of a single sequence assembly of all reads from different samples, typically as part of a comparative metagenomic analysis.

label: Peak calling
description: Identify putative protein-binding regions in a genome sequence from analysis of Chip-sequencing data or ChIP-on-chip data.|Chip-sequencing combines chromatin immunoprecipitation (ChIP) with massively parallel DNA sequencing to generate a set of reads, which are aligned to a genome sequence.  The enriched areas contain the binding sites of DNA-associated proteins.  For example, a transcription factor binding site. ChIP-on-chip in contrast combines chromatin immunoprecipitation ('ChIP') with microarray ('chip').  "Peak-pair calling" is similar to "Peak calling" in the context of ChIP-exo.

label: Optimisation and refinement
description: Refine or optimise some data model.

label: Protein property comparison
description: Compare the physicochemical properties of two or more proteins (or reference data).

label: Molecular surface comparison
description: Compare two or more molecular surfaces.

label: Molecular docking
description: Model the structure of a protein in complex with a small molecule or another macromolecule.|This includes protein-protein interactions, protein-nucleic acid, protein-ligand binding etc. Methods might predict whether the molecules are likely to bind in vivo, their conformation when bound, the strength of the interaction, possible mutations to achieve bonding and so on.

label: Single particle analysis
description: An image processing technique that combines and analyze multiple images of a particulate sample, in order to produce an image with clearer features that are more easily interpreted.|Single particle analysis is used to improve the information that can be obtained by relatively low resolution techniques, , e.g. an image of a protein or virus from transmission electron microscopy (TEM).

label: Text annotation
description: Text annotation is the operation of adding notes, data and metadata, recognised entities and concepts, and their relations to a text (such as a scientific article).

label: Protein titration curve plotting
description: Plot a protein titration curve.

label: Differential gene expression analysis
description: Identify from molecular sequence analysis (typically from analysis of microarray or RNA-seq data) genes whose expression levels are significantly different between two sample groups.|Differential gene expression analysis is used, for example, to identify which genes are up-regulated (increased expression) or down-regulated (decreased expression) between a group treated with a drug and a control groups.

label: Text mining
description: Process and analyse text (typically scientific literature) to extract information from it.

label: Nucleic acid melting profile plotting
description: Calculate and plot a DNA or DNA/RNA melting profile.|A melting profile is used to visualise and analyse partly melted DNA conformations.

label: Topology diagram drawing
description: Render a topology diagram of protein secondary structure.

label: Haplotype mapping
description: Infer haplotypes, either alleles at multiple loci that are transmitted together on the same chromosome, or a set of single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) on a single chromatid that are statistically associated.|Haplotype inference can help in population genetic studies and the identification of complex disease genes, , and is typically based on aligned single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) fragments. Haplotype comparison is a useful way to characterize the genetic variation between individuals. An individual's haplotype describes which nucleotide base occurs at each position for a set of common SNPs. Tools might use combinatorial functions (for example parsimony) or a likelihood function or model with optimisation such as minimum error correction (MEC) model, expectation-maximisation algorithm (EM), genetic algorithm or Markov chain Monte Carlo (MCMC).

label: Service discovery
description: An operation supporting the browsing or discovery of other tools and services.

label: Post-translation modification site prediction
description: Predict post-translation modification sites in protein sequences.|Methods might predict sites of methylation, N-terminal myristoylation, N-terminal acetylation, sumoylation, palmitoylation, phosphorylation, sulfation, glycosylation, glycosylphosphatidylinositol (GPI) modification sites (GPI lipid anchor signals) etc.

label: Polymorphism detection
description: Detect mutations in multiple DNA sequences, for example, from the alignment and comparison of the fluorescent traces produced by DNA sequencing hardware.

label: Protein flexibility and motion analysis
description: Analyse flexibility and motion in protein structure.|Use this concept for analysis of flexible and rigid residues, local chain deformability, regions undergoing conformational change, molecular vibrations or fluctuational dynamics, domain motions or other large-scale structural transitions in a protein structure.

label: Split read mapping
description: A varient of oligonucleotide mapping where a read is mapped to two separate locations because of possible structural variation.

label: Peptide immunogenicity prediction
description: Predict antigenicity, allergenicity / immunogenicity, allergic cross-reactivity etc of peptides and proteins.|This includes methods that generate a graphical rendering of antigenicity of a protein, such as a Hopp and Woods plot.|This is usually done in the development of peptide-specific antibodies or multi-epitope vaccines. Methods might use sequence data (for example motifs) and / or structural data.

label: Protein super-secondary structure prediction
description: Predict super-secondary structure of protein sequence(s).|Super-secondary structures include leucine zippers, coiled coils, Helix-Turn-Helix etc.

label: Base position variability plotting
description: Identify and plot third base position variability in a nucleotide sequence.

label: Vector sequence detection
description: Detect vector sequences in nucleotide sequence, typically by comparison to a set of known vector sequences.

label: Structural variation detection
description: Detect large regions in a genome subject to copy-number variation, or other structural variations in genome(s).|Methods might involve analysis of whole-genome array comparative genome hybridisation or single-nucleotide polymorphism arrays, paired-end mapping of sequencing data, or from analysis of short reads from new sequencing technologies.

label: trans-regulatory element prediction
description: Identify or predict functional RNA sequences with a gene regulatory role (trans-regulatory elements) or targets.|Trans-regulatory elements regulate genes distant from the gene from which they were transcribed.

label: Metabolic network modelling
description: Model a metabolic network, for example, to reconstruct pathways or to simulate metabolism.

label: Codon usage table generation
description: Calculate codon usage statistics and create a codon usage table.

label: Dot plot plotting
description: Render a representation of a distribution that consists of group of data points plotted on a simple scale.|Dot plots are useful when having not too many (e.g. 20) data points for each category. Example: draw a dotplot of sequence similarities identified from word-matching or character comparison.

label: Molecular surface calculation
description: Calculate the molecular surface area in proteins and other macromolecules.

label: Genetic mapping
description: Generate a genetic (linkage) map of a DNA sequence (typically a chromosome) showing the relative positions of genetic markers based on estimation of non-physical distances.|Mapping involves ordering genetic loci along a chromosome and estimating the physical distance between loci. A genetic map shows the relative (not physical) position of known genes and genetic markers.|This includes mapping of the genetic architecture of dynamic complex traits (functional mapping), e.g. by characterisation of the underlying quantitative trait loci (QTLs) or nucleotides (QTNs).

label: Protein function comparison
description: Compare the functional properties of two or more proteins.

label: Chromatographic alignment
description: Align multiple data sets using information from chromatography and/or peptide identification, from mass spectrometry experiments.

label: Peak detection
description: Identify peaks in a spectrum from a mass spectrometry, NMR, or some other spectrum-generating experiment.

label: Enzyme kinetics calculation
description: Calculate Km, Vmax and derived data for an enzyme reaction.

label: Sequence feature detection
description: Predict, recognise and identify positional features in molecular sequences such as key functional sites or regions.|Look at "Protein feature detection" (http://edamontology.org/operation_3092) and "Nucleic acid feature detection" (http://edamontology.org/operation_0415) in case more specific terms are needed.

label: Neurite measurement
description: Measurement of neurites; projections (axons or dendrites) from the cell body of a neuron, from analysis of neuron images.

label: Protein extinction coefficient calculation
description: Predict extinction coefficients or optical density of a protein sequence.

label: Global alignment
description: Globally align two or more molecular sequences.|Global alignment methods identify similarity across the entire length of the sequences.

label: Phylogenetic tree visualisation
description: Render or visualise a phylogenetic tree.

synonyms: Gene expression quantitative trait loci profiling
label: Gene expression QTL analysis
description: Combine classical quantitative trait loci (QTL) analysis with gene expression profiling, for example, to describe describe cis- and trans-controlling elements for the expression of phenotype associated genes.

label: Read pre-processing
description: Pre-process sequence reads to ensure (or improve) quality and reliability.|For example process paired end reads to trim low quality ends remove short sequences, identify sequence inserts, detect chimeric reads, or remove low quality sequnces including vector, adaptor, low complexity and contaminant sequences. Sequences might come from genomic DNA library, EST libraries, SSH library and so on.

label: Heat map generation
description: Generate a heat map of expression data from e.g. microarray data.|The heat map usually uses a coloring scheme to represent expression values. They can show how quantitative measurements were influenced by experimental conditions.

label: Relation extraction
description: Identify semantic relations among entities and concepts within a text, using text mining techniques.

label: Rarefaction
description: The calculation of species richness for a number of individual samples, based on plots of the number of species as a function of the number of samples (rarefaction curves).

label: Scatter plot plotting
description: Render a graph in which the values of two variables are plotted along two axes; the pattern of the points reveals any correlation.

label: Simulated gene expression data generation
description: Simulate gene expression data, e.g. for purposes of benchmarking.

synonyms: Phylogenetic tree construction (maximum likelihood and Bayesian methods)
label: Phylogenetic tree generation (maximum likelihood and Bayesian methods)
description: Construct a phylogenetic tree by relating sequence data to a hypothetical tree topology using a model of sequence evolution.|Maximum likelihood methods search for a tree that maximizes a likelihood function, i.e. that is most likely given the data and model. Bayesian analysis estimate the probability of tree for branch lengths and topology, typically using a Monte Carlo algorithm.

label: Sequence generation (protein)
description: Generate a protein sequence by some means.

label: Multiple sequence alignment
description: Align more than two molecular sequences.|This includes methods that use an existing alignment, for example to incorporate sequences into an alignment, or combine several multiple alignments into a single, improved alignment.

label: Structure database search
description: Search a tertiary structure database, typically by sequence and/or structure comparison, or some other means, and retrieve structures and associated data.

label: Protein architecture analysis
description: Analyse the architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure) of protein structure(s).

label: Classification
description: Assign molecular sequences, structures or other biological data to a specific group or category according to qualities it shares with that group or category.

label: Gene expression analysis
description: The application of bioinformatics methods to the study of gene products, typically by processing gene expression data or profiles, interpreting them in functional terms.

label: Protein architecture recognition
description: Identify the architecture of a protein structure.|Includes methods that try to suggest the most likely biological unit for a given protein X-ray crystal structure based on crystal symmetry and scoring of putative protein-protein interfaces.

label: Phylogenetic tree generation (from gene frequencies)
description: Phylogenetic tree construction from gene frequency data.

label: cis-regulatory element prediction
description: Identify, predict or analyse cis-regulatory elements  in DNA sequences (TATA box, Pribnow box, SOS box, CAAT box, CCAAT box, operator etc.) or in RNA sequences (e.g. riboswitches).|Cis-regulatory elements (cis-elements) regulate the expression of genes located on the same strand from which the element was transcribed. Cis-elements are found in the 5' promoter region of the gene, in an intron, or in the 3' untranslated region. Cis-elements are often binding sites of one or more trans-acting factors. They also occur in RNA sequences, e.g. a riboswitch is a region of an mRNA molecule that bind a small target molecule that regulates the gene's activity.

label: Sequencing error detection
description: Detect errors in DNA sequences generated from sequencing projects).

label: Local structure alignment
description: Locally align (superimpose) two or more molecular tertiary structures.|Local alignment methods identify regions of local similarity, common substructures etc.

label: Splice site prediction
description: Identify, predict or analyse splice sites in nucleotide sequences.|Methods might require a pre-mRNA or genomic DNA sequence.

label: Translation initiation site prediction
description: Predict translation initiation sites, possibly by searching a database of sites.

label: Chimera detection
description: Detects chimeric sequences (chimeras) from a sequence alignment.|A chimera includes regions from two or more phylogenetically distinct sequences. They are usually artifacts of PCR and are thought to occur when a prematurely terminated amplicon reanneals to another DNA strand and is subsequently copied to completion in later PCR cycles.

label: Isotopic distributions calculation
description: Calculate the isotope distribution of a given chemical species.

label: Statistical calculation
description: Perform a statistical data operation of some type, e.g. calibration or validation.

label: Nucleic acid thermodynamic property calculation
description: Calculate a thermodynamic property of DNA or DNA/RNA, such as melting temperature, enthalpy and entropy.

label: Structure analysis
description: Analyse known molecular tertiary structures.

label: Functional clustering
description: Clustering of molecular sequences on the basis of their function, typically using information from an ontology of gene function, or some other measure of functional phenotype.

label: Base-calling
description: Identify base (nucleobase) sequence from a fluorescence 'trace' data generated by an automated DNA sequencer.

label: Gene-set enrichment analysis
description: Analysis of a set of genes, corresponding e.g. to a gene expression profile, annotated with Gene Ontology (GO) concepts, where eventual over-/under-representation of certain GO concept within the studied set of genes is revealed.|The Gene Ontology (GO) is typically used, the input is a set of Gene IDs, and the output of the analysis is typically a ranked list of GO concepts, each associated with a p-value.

label: siRNA duplex prediction
description: Identify or predict siRNA duplexes in RNA.

label: Calculation
description: Mathematical determination of the value of something, typically a properly of a  molecule.

label: Named-entity and concept recognition
description: Recognise named entities, ontology concepts, tags, events, and dictionary terms within documents.

label: Protein interaction analysis
description: Analyse known protein-protein, protein-DNA/RNA or protein-ligand interactions.

label: Query and retrieval
description: Search or query a data resource and retrieve entries and / or annotation.

label: Protein geometry validation
description: Validate protein geometry, for example bond lengths, bond angles, torsion angles, chiralities, planaraties etc.

label: Scaffolding
description: Link together a non-contiguous series of genomic sequences into a scaffold, consisting of sequences separated by gaps of known length.  The sequences that are linked are typically typically contigs; contiguous sequences corresponding to read overlaps.|Scaffold may be positioned along a chromosome physical map to create a "golden path".

label: Gene prediction
description: Detect, predict and identify genes or components of genes in DNA sequences, including promoters, coding regions, splice sites, etc. |Methods for gene prediction might be ab initio, based on phylogenetic comparisons, use motifs, sequence features, support vector machine, alignment etc.

label: Retention time prediction
description: Prediction of retention time in a mass spectrometry experiment based on compositional and structural properties of the separated species.

synonyms: Expression data tree or dendrogram rendering
label: Dendrogram visualisation
description: Visualise clustered expression data using a tree diagram.

label: Protein crystallizability prediction
description: Predict crystallizability of a protein sequence.

label: Radiation Hybrid Mapping
description: Generate a physical (radiation hybrid) map of genetic markers in a DNA sequence using provided radiation hybrid (RH) scores for one or more markers.

label: Weighted correlation network analysis
description: A data mining method typically used for studying biological networks based on pairwise correlations between variables.

label: Codon usage bias plotting
description: Generate a codon usage bias plot.

label: Residue interaction prediction
description: Predict contacts, non-covalent interactions and distance (constraints) between amino acids in protein sequences.|Methods usually involve multiple sequence alignment analysis.

label: Target-Decoy
description: Statistical estimation of false discovery rate from score distribution for peptide-spectrum-matches, following a peptide database search, and by comparison to search results with a database containing incorrect information.

label: Molecular dynamics
description: Simulate molecular (typically protein) conformation using a computational model of physical forces and computer simulation.

label: RNA secondary structure prediction
description: Predict RNA secondary structure (for example knots, pseudoknots, alternative structures etc).|Methods might use RNA motifs, predicted intermolecular contacts, or RNA sequence-structure compatibility (inverse RNA folding).

label: Phylogenetic tree generation (quartet methods)
description: Construct a phylogenetic tree by computing four-taxon trees (4-trees) and searching for the phylogeny that matches most closely.

label: Network simulation
description: Simulate the bevaviour of a biological pathway or network.

label: Phylogenetic tree generation (from molecular sequences)
description: Phylogenetic tree construction from molecular sequences.|Methods typically compare multiple molecular sequence and estimate evolutionary distances and relationships to infer gene families or make functional predictions.

label: Protein sequence cleavage
description: Cleave a protein sequence into peptide fragments (corresponding to enzymatic or chemical cleavage).

label: Sequence comparison
description: Compare two or more molecular sequences.

label: Molecular replacement
description: A technique used to construct an atomic model of an unknown structure from diffraction data, based upon an atomic model of a known structure, either a related protein or the same protein from a different crystal form.|The technique solves the phase problem, i.e. retrieve information concern phases of the structure.

label: Sequence feature comparison
description: Compare the feature tables of two or more molecular sequences.

label: Generation
description: Construct some data entity.|For non-analytical operations, see the 'Processing' branch.

label: Copy number estimation
description: Estimate the number of copies of loci of particular gene(s) in DNA sequences typically from gene-expression profiling technology based on microarray hybridisation-based experiments. For example, estimate copy number (or marker dosage) of a dominant marker in samples from polyploid plant cells or tissues, or chromosomal gains and losses in tumors.|Methods typically implement some statistical model for hypothesis testing, and methods estimate total copy number, i.e. do not distinguish the two inherited chromosomes quantities (specific copy number).

label: Protein identification
description: Identification of protein, for example from one or more peptide identifications by tandem mass spectrometry.

label: Repeat sequence detection
description: Find (and possibly render) short repetitive subsequences (repeat sequences) in (typically nucleotide) sequences.

label: Expression data visualisation
description: Visualise microarray or other expression data.

label: Nucleic acid probability profile plotting
description: Calculate and plot a DNA or DNA/RNA probability profile.

label: Phylogenetic tree generation (parsimony methods)
description: Construct a phylogenetic tree by computing a sequence alignment and searching for the tree with the fewest number of character-state changes from the alignment.|This includes evolutionary parsimony (invariants) methods.

label: Promoter prediction
description: Identify or predict whole promoters or promoter elements (transcription start sites, RNA polymerase binding site, transcription factor binding sites, promoter enhancers etc) in DNA sequences.|Methods might recognize CG content, CpG islands, splice sites, polyA signals etc.

label: Mass spectra calibration
description: Re-adjust the output of mass spectrometry experiments with shifted ppm values.

label: Sequence alignment refinement
description: Refine an existing sequence alignment.

label: Document clustering
description: Cluster (group) documents on the basis of their calculated similarity.

label: Plasmid map drawing
description: Draw a circular maps of DNA, for example a plasmid map.

label: Differentially-methylated region identification
description: Identify and assess specific genes or regulatory regions of interest that are differentially methylated.

label: Pairwise sequence alignment
description: Align exactly two molecular sequences.|Methods might perform one-to-one, one-to-many or many-to-many comparisons.

label: Service management
description: Operations concerning the handling and use of other tools.

label: Spectral counting
description: Calculate number of identified MS2 spectra as approximation of peptide / protein quantity.

label: DNA back-translation
description: Back-translate a protein sequence into DNA.

label: Protein structure analysis
description: Analyse protein structural data.

label: Codon usage fraction calculation
description: Calculate the differences in codon usage fractions between two sequences, sets of sequences, codon usage tables etc.

label: Metabolic labeling
description: Labeling all proteins and (possibly) all amino acids using C-13 or N-15 enriched grown medium or feed.|This includes N-15 metabolic labeling (labeling all proteins and (possibly) all amino acids using N-15 enriched grown medium or feed) and C-13 metabolic labeling (labeling all proteins and (possibly) all amino acids using C-13 enriched grown medium or feed).

label: Analysis
description: Apply analytical methods to existing data of a specific type.|This excludes non-analytical methods that read and write the same basic type of data (for that, see 'Data handling').

label: Pathway or network comparison
description: Compare two or more biological pathways or networks.

label: Protein pKa calculation
description: Calculate pH-dependent properties from pKa calculations of a protein sequence.

label: Ramachandran plot validation
description: Validate a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.

label: Protein hydrogen exchange rate calculation
description: Estimate hydrogen exchange rate of a protein sequence.

label: Molecular surface analysis
description: Analyse the surface properties of proteins or other macromolecules, including surface accessible pockets, interior inaccessible cavities etc.

label: Filtering
description: Filter a set of files or data items according to some property.

label: Peptide identification
description: Determination of peptide sequence from mass spectrum.

label: Protein geometry calculation
description: Calculate, visualise or analyse phi/psi angles of a protein structure.

label: Sequence database search
description:
Search a sequence database by sequence comparison and retrieve similar sequences.

sequences matching a given sequence motif or pattern, such as a Prosite pattern or regular expression.|This excludes direct retrieval methods (e.g. the dbfetch program).

label: siRNA binding specificity prediction
description: Assess binding specificity of putative siRNA sequence(s), for example for a functional assay, typically with respect to designing specific siRNA sequences.

label: Phylogenetic sub/super tree detection
description: Compare two or more phylogenetic trees to detect subtrees or supertrees.

label: Quantification
description: Counting and measuring experimentally determined observations into quantities.

label: Sequence checksum generation
description: Generate a checksum of a molecular sequence.

label: Protein globularity prediction
description: Predict the stability or globularity of a protein sequence, whether it is intrinsically unfolded etc.

label: 3D profile generation
description: Generate some type of structural (3D) profile or template from a structure or structure alignment.

label: Phylogenetic tree bootstrapping
description: Apply bootstrapping or other measures to estimate confidence of a phylogenetic tree.

label: Genome feature comparison
description: Compare the features of two genome sequences.|Genomic elements that might be compared include genes, indels, single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs), retrotransposons, tandem repeats and so on.

label: Sequence motif recognition
description: Find (scan for) known motifs, patterns and regular expressions in molecular sequence(s).

label: Protein solubility prediction
description: Predict the solubility or atomic solvation energy of a protein sequence.

label: Sequence masking
description: Mask characters in a molecular sequence (replacing those characters with a mask character).|For example, SNPs or repeats in a DNA sequence might be masked.

label: DNA structure prediction
description: Predict DNA tertiary structure.

label: Gene functional annotation
description: Annotate one or more sequences with functional information, such as cellular processes or metaobolic pathways, by reference to a controlled vocabulary - invariably the Gene Ontology (GO).

label: Protein distance matrix calculation
description: Calculate a matrix of distance between residues (for example the C-alpha atoms) in a protein structure.

label: Nucleic acid sequence analysis
description: Analyse a nucleic acid sequence (using methods that are only applicable to nucleic acid sequences).

label: Genome annotation
description: Annotate a genome sequence with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

label: Sequence cluster visualisation
description: Visualise, format or render sequence clusters.

label: Protein secondary structure prediction (turns)
description: Predict turn structure (for example beta hairpin turns) of protein sequences.

label: Sequence ambiguity calculation
description: Calculate sequence ambiguity, for example identity regions in protein or nucleotide sequences with many ambiguity codes.

label: Phylogenetic tree distances calculation
description: Compare two or more phylogenetic trees to calculate distances between trees.

label: Isotope-coded protein label
description: Chemical tagging free amino groups of intact proteins with stable isotopes.

label: Ab-initio gene prediction
description: Prediction of genes or gene components from first principles, i.e. without reference to existing genes.

label: Restriction site recognition
description: Find and identify restriction enzyme cleavage sites (restriction sites) in (typically) DNA sequences, for example to generate a restriction map.

label: Imputation
description: Replace missing data with substituted values, usually by using some statistical or other mathematical approach.

label: PTM localisation
description: Site localisation of post-translational modifications in peptide or protein mass spectra.

label: Chemical similarity enrichment
description: Analyse a dataset with respect to concepts from an ontology of chemical structure, leveraging chemical similarity information.

label: Sequence motif comparison
description: Find motifs shared by molecular sequences.

label: Quadruplex formation site detection
description: Detect quadruplex-forming motifs in nucleotide sequences.|Quadruplex (4-stranded) structures are formed by guanine-rich regions and are implicated in various important biological processes and as therapeutic targets.

label: Gene expression correlation
description: Analyse the correlation patterns among genes across across a variety of experiments, microarray samples etc.

label: Protein-nucleic acid binding prediction
description: Predict RNA and DNA-binding binding sites in protein sequences.|This includes methods that predict and optimise zinc finger protein domains for DNA/RNA binding (for example for transcription factors and nucleases).

label: Nucleic acid property calculation
description: Calculate or predict physical or chemical properties of nucleic acid molecules, including any non-positional properties of the molecular sequence.

label: Treemap visualisation
description: Visualise gene expression data after hierarchical clustering for representing hierarchical relationships.

label: Sequence editing
description: Edit or change a molecular sequence, either randomly or specifically.

label: Nucleic acid structure comparison
description: Compare nucleic acid tertiary structures.

label: Sequence visualisation
description: Visualise, format or render a molecular sequence or sequences such as a sequence alignment, possibly with sequence features or properties shown.

label: Sequence alignment conversion
description: Convert a molecular sequence alignment from one type to another (for example amino acid to coding nucleotide sequence).

label: iTRAQ
description: Quantification analysis using the AB SCIEX iTRAQ isobaric labelling workflow, wherein 2-8 reporter ions are measured in MS2 spectra near 114 m/z.

label: Community profiling
description: Analyse DNA sequences in order to identify a DNA 'barcode'; marker genes or any short fragment(s) of DNA that are useful to diagnose the taxa of biological organisms.

label: Chromatogram visualisation
description: Visualise, format or render an image of a Chromatogram.

label: Phylogenetic tree reconstruction
description: Reconstructing the inner node labels of a phylogenetic tree from its leafes.|Note that this is somewhat different from simply analysing an existing tree or constructing a completely new one.

label: Gene set testing
description: Analyse gene expression patterns (typically from DNA microarray datasets) to identify sets of genes that are associated with a specific trait, condition, clinical outcome etc.|Gene sets can be defined beforehand by biological function, chromosome locations and so on.

label: Protein feature detection
description: Predict, recognise and identify positional features in proteins from analysing protein sequences or structures.|Features includes functional sites or regions, secondary structure, structural domains and so on. Methods might use fingerprints, motifs, profiles, hidden Markov models, sequence alignment etc to provide a mapping of a query protein sequence to a discriminatory element. This includes methods that search a secondary protein database (Prosite, Blocks, ProDom, Prints, Pfam etc.) to assign a protein sequence(s) to a known protein family or group.

label: Sequence alignment editing
description: Edit, convert or otherwise change a molecular sequence alignment, either randomly or specifically.

label: Read summarisation
description: Counting and summarising the number of short sequence reads that map to genomic features.

label: Nucleic acid density plotting
description: Calculate a density plot (of base composition) for a nucleotide sequence.

label: Deisotoping
description: The removal of isotope peaks in a spectrum, to represent the fragment ion as one data point.|Deisotoping is commonly done to reduce complexity, and done in conjunction with the charge state deconvolution.

label: Format validation
description: Test and validate the format and content of a data file.

label: Sequence distance matrix generation
description: Calculate a sequence distance matrix or otherwise estimate genetic distances between molecular sequences.

label: Transcription factor binding site prediction
description: Identify or predict transcription factor binding sites in DNA sequences.

label: DNA substitution modelling
description: Identify a plausible model of DNA substitution that explains a molecular (DNA or protein) sequence alignment.

label: Protein sequence analysis
description: Analyse a protein sequence (using methods that are only applicable to protein sequences).

label: Phylogenetic tree generation (data centric)
description: Construct a phylogenetic tree from a specific type of data.

label: Nucleic acid restriction digest
description: Generate digest fragments for a nucleotide sequence containing restriction sites.

label: Splicing model analysis
description: Analyse, characterize and model alternative splicing events, typically by comparing multiple nucleic acid sequences.

label: Structure editing
description: Edit, convert or otherwise change a  molecular tertiary structure, either randomly or specifically.

label: Linkage disequilibrium calculation
description: Calculate linkage disequilibrium; the non-random association of alleles or polymorphisms at two or more loci (not necessarily on the same chromosome).|Linkage disequilibrium is identified where a combination of alleles (or genetic markers) occurs more or less frequently in a population than expected by chance formation of haplotypes.

label: Variant filtering
description: Variant filtering is used to eliminate false positive variants based for example on base calling quality, strand and position information, and mapping info.

label: Sequence profile alignment
description: Align molecular sequence(s) to sequence profile(s), or profiles to other profiles.  A profile typically represents a sequence alignment.|A sequence profile typically represents a sequence alignment. Methods might perform one-to-one, one-to-many or many-to-many comparisons.

label: RNA secondary structure analysis
description: Process (read and / or write) RNA secondary structure data.

label: Clustering
description: Group together some data entities on the basis of similarities such that entities in the same group (cluster) are more similar to each other than to those in other groups (clusters).

label: Operon drawing
description: Visualise operon structure etc.

label: 18O labeling
description: Quantification analysis using labeling based on 18O-enriched H2O.

label: Global structure alignment
description: Globally align (superimpose) two or more molecular tertiary structures.|Global alignment methods identify similarity across the entire structures.

label: Microarray probe design
description: Predict and/or optimize oligonucleotide probes for DNA microarrays, for example for transcription profiling of genes, or for genomes and gene families.

label: Repeat sequence organisation analysis
description: Analyse repeat sequence organisation such as periodicity.

label: Protein binding site prediction
description: Identify or predict catalytic residues, active sites or other ligand-binding sites in protein sequences or structures.

label: Nucleic acid design
description: Design (or predict) nucleic acid sequences with specific chemical or physical properties.

label: RNA-Seq analysis
description: Analyze data from RNA-seq experiments.

label: Hydrogen bond calculation
description: Identify potential hydrogen bonds between amino acids and other groups.|The output might include the atoms involved in the bond, bond geometric parameters and bond enthalpy.

label: Service composition
description: An operation supporting the aggregation of other services (at least two) into a funtional unit, for the automation of some task.

label: RNA structure prediction
description: Predict RNA tertiary structure.

label: Deposition
description: Deposit some data in a database or some other type of repository or software system.|For non-analytical operations, see the 'Processing' branch.

label: Protein modelling
description: Build a three-dimensional protein model based on known (for example homologs) structures.|The model might be of a whole, part or aspect of protein structure. Molecular modelling methods might use sequence-structure alignment, structural templates, molecular dynamics, energy minimisation etc.

label: Diffraction data analysis
description: Analysis of data from a diffraction experiment.

label: Correlation
description: Identify a correlation, i.e. a statistical relationship between two random variables or two sets of data.

label: Phylogenetic tree generation
description: Construct a phylogenetic tree.|Phylogenetic trees are usually constructed from a set of sequences from which an alignment (or data matrix) is calculated.

label: Sequence cutting
description: Cut (remove) characters or a region from a molecular sequence.

label: Variant calling
description: Identify and map genomic alterations, including single nucleotide polymorphisms, short indels and structural variants, in a genome sequence.|Somatic variant calling is the detection of variations established in somatic cells and hence not inherited as a germ line variant.|Variant detection|Methods often utilise a database of aligned reads.

label: Reference identification
description: Identification of the best reference for mapping for a specific dataset from a list of potential references, when performing genetic variation analysis.

label: Salt bridge calculation
description: Calculate (and possibly score) salt bridges in a protein structure.|Salt bridges are interactions between oppositely charged atoms in different residues. The output might include the inter-atomic distance.

label: Read mapping
description: Align short oligonucleotide sequences (reads) to a larger (genomic) sequence.|The purpose of read mapping is to identify the location of sequenced fragments within a reference genome and assumes that there is, in fact, at least local similarity between the fragment and reference sequences.

label: Transmembrane protein analysis
description: Analyse transmembrane protein(s), typically by processing sequence and / or structural data, and write an informative report for example about the protein and its transmembrane domains / regions.|Use this (or child) concept for analysis of transmembrane domains (buried and exposed faces), transmembrane helices, helix topology, orientation, inter-helical contacts, membrane dipping (re-entrant) loops and other secondary structure etc. Methods might use pattern discovery, hidden Markov models, sequence alignment, structural profiles, amino acid property analysis, comparison to known domains or some combination (hybrid methods).

label: RNA-Seq quantification
description: Quantification of data arising from RNA-Seq high-throughput sequencing, typically the quantification of transcript abundances durnig transcriptome analysis in a gene expression study.

label: Spectral library search
description: Match experimentally measured mass spectrum to a spectrum in a spectral library or database.

label: Phylogenetic tree analysis (natural selection)
description: Analyse a phylogenetic tree to identify allele frequency distribution and change that is subject to evolutionary pressures (natural selection, genetic drift, mutation and gene flow). Identify type of natural selection (such as stabilizing, balancing or disruptive).|Stabilizing/purifying (directional) selection favors a single phenotype and tends to decrease genetic diversity as a population stabilizes on a particular trait, selecting out trait extremes or deleterious mutations. In contrast, balancing selection maintain genetic polymorphisms (or multiple alleles), whereas disruptive (or diversifying) selection favors individuals at both extremes of a trait.

label: Protein hydropathy calculation
description: Analyse the hydrophobic, hydrophilic or charge properties of a protein (from analysis of sequence or structural information).

label: In vitro selection
description: A technique whereby molecules with desired properties and function are isolated from libraries of random molecules, through iterative cycles of selection, amplification, and mutagenesis.

label: Protein architecture comparison
description: Compare the architecture of two or more protein structures.

label: Phylogenetic tree analysis (shape)
description: Analyse the shape (topology) of a phylogenetic tree.

label: Transcriptome assembly
description: Infer a transcriptome sequence by analysis of short sequence reads.

label: Sequence conversion
description: Convert a molecular sequence from one type to another.

label: Protein signal peptide detection
description: Detect or predict signal peptides and signal peptide cleavage sites in protein sequences.|Methods might use sequence motifs and features, amino acid composition, profiles, machine-learned classifiers, etc.

label: Ion counting
description: Label-free quantification by integration of ion current (ion counting).

label: Single particle alignment and classification
description: Compare (align and classify) multiple particle images from a micrograph in order to produce a representative image of the particle. |A micrograph can include particles in multiple different orientations and/or conformations. Particles are compared and organised into sets based on their similarity. Typically iterations of classification and alignment and are performed to optimise the final 3D EM map.

label: Structure visualisation
description: Visualise or render molecular structure, for example a high-quality static picture or animation.  This includes secondary structure such as knots, pseudoknots etc. as well as tertiary and quaternary structure.

label: Phylogenetic tree analysis (gene family prediction)
description: Predict families of genes and gene function based on their position in a phylogenetic tree.

label: Sequence similarity search
description: Search a sequence database and retrieve sequences that are similar to a query sequence.

label: PTM identification
description: Identification of post-translational modifications (PTMs) of peptides/proteins in mass spectrum.

label: Visualisation
description: Visualise, plot or render (graphically) biomolecular data such as molecular sequences or structures.

label: Gene methylation analysis
description: Analysing the DNA methylation of specific genes or regions of interest.

label: Local alignment
description: Locally align two or more molecular sequences.|Local alignment methods identify regions of local similarity.

label: Microscope image visualisation
description: Visualise images resulting from various types of microscopy.

label: Diffraction data integration
description: The evaluation of diffraction intensities and integration of diffraction maxima from a diffraction experiment.

label: Genetic variation analysis
description: Analyse a genetic variation, for example to annotate its location, alleles, classification, and effects on individual transcripts predicted for a gene model.|Genetic variation annotation provides contextual interpretation of coding SNP consequences in transcripts. It allows comparisons to be made between variation data in different populations or strains for the same transcript.

label: Sequence assembly visualisation
description: Render and visualise a DNA sequence assembly.

label: Coding region prediction
description: Predict protein-coding regions (CDS or exon) or open reading frames in nucleotide sequences.

label: Scaffold gap completion
description: Fill the gaps in a sequence assembly (scaffold) by merging in additional sequences.|Different techniques are used to generate gap sequences to connect contigs, depending on the size of the gap. For small (5-20kb) gaps, PCR amplification and sequencing is used.  For large (>20kb) gaps, fragments are cloned (e.g. in BAC (Bacterial artificial chromosomes) vectors) and then sequenced.

label: Protein cysteine and disulfide bond assignment
description: Assign cysteine bonding state and disulfide bond partners in protein structures.

label: Cell migration analysis
description: Analysis of cell migration images in order to study cell migration, typically in order to study the processes that play a role in the disease progression.

label: Protein secondary structure prediction (coils)
description: Predict open coils, non-regular secondary structure and intrinsically disordered / unstructured regions of protein sequences.

label: Principal component plotting
description: Visualize the results of a principal component analysis (orthogonal data transformation).

label: Transcriptional regulatory element prediction
description: Identify or predict transcriptional regulatory motifs, patterns, elements or regions in DNA sequences.|This includes promoters, enhancers, silencers and boundary elements / insulators, regulatory protein or transcription factor binding sites etc. Methods might be specific to a particular genome and use motifs, word-based / grammatical methods, position-specific frequency matrices, discriminative pattern analysis etc.

label: Regression analysis
description: A statistical calculation to estimate the relationships among variables.

label: Protein modelling (backbone)
description: Model protein backbone conformation.|Methods might require a preliminary C(alpha) trace.

label: Sequence alignment analysis
description: Analyse a molecular sequence alignment.

label: Nucleic acid comparison
description: Compare two or more nucleic acids to identify similarities.

label: Protein-nucleic acid binding site analysis
description: Analyse RNA or DNA-binding sites in protein structure.

label: Database search
description: Search a database (or other data resource) with a supplied query and retrieve entries (or parts of entries) that are similar to the query.|Typically the query is compared to each entry and high scoring matches (hits) are returned. For example, a BLAST search of a sequence database.

label: Peptide database search
description: Determination of best matches between MS/MS spectrum and a database of protein or nucleic acid sequences.

label: Probabilistic data generation
description: Generate some data from a choosen probibalistic model, possibly to evaluate algorithms.

label: Conversion
description: Convert a data set from one form to another.

label: Nucleic acid sequence reverse and complement
description: Generate the reverse and / or complement of a nucleotide sequence.

label: Gene expression clustering
description: Perform cluster analysis of gene expression data to identify groups with similar gene-expression profiles, for example by clustering.

label: Literature search
description: Query scientific literature, in search for articles, article data, concepts, named entities, or for statistics.

label: Sequence merging
description: Merge two or more (typically overlapping) molecular sequences.

label: Label-free quantification
description: Quantification without the use of chemical tags.

label: Mass spectrum visualisation
description: Visualise, format or render a mass spectrum.

label: Sequence assembly
description: Combine (align and merge) overlapping fragments of a DNA sequence to reconstruct the original sequence.|For example, assemble overlapping reads from paired-end sequencers into contigs (a contiguous sequence corresponding to read overlaps). Or assemble contigs, for example ESTs and genomic DNA fragments, depending on the detected fragment overlaps.

label: Protein-protein interaction prediction
description: Identify or predict protein-protein interactions, interfaces, binding sites etc.

label: Genome indexing
description: Generate an index of a genome sequence.|Many sequence alignment tasks involving many or very large sequences rely on a precomputed index of the sequence to accelerate the alignment.  The Burrows-Wheeler Transform (BWT) is a permutation of the genome based on a suffix array algorithm.  A suffix array consists of the lexicographically sorted list of suffixes of a genome.

label: Sequence annotation
description: Annotate a molecular sequence record with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

label: Pathway or network prediction
description: Predict a molecular pathway or network.

label: Image annotation
description: Annotate an image of some sort, typically with terms from a controlled vocabulary.

label: Protein secondary structure assignment
description: Assign secondary structure from protein coordinate or experimental data.

label: tRNA gene prediction
description: Identify or predict tRNA genes in genomic sequences (tRNA).

label: Virulence prediction
description: The prediction of the degree of pathogenicity of a microorganism from analysis of molecular sequences.

label: SILAC
description: Quantification analysis using stable isotope labeling by amino acids in cell culture.

label: Whole genome methylation analysis
description: Measure the overall level of methyl cytosines in a genome from analysis of experimental data, typically from chromatographic methods and methyl accepting capacity assay.

label: Protein isoelectric point calculation
description: Calculate isoelectric point of a protein sequence.

label: Formatting
description: Reformat a file of data (or equivalent entity in memory).

label: Protein interaction prediction
description: Predict the interactions of proteins with other molecules.

label: Sequence alignment comparison
description: Compare (typically by aligning) two molecular sequence alignments.|See also 'Sequence profile alignment'.

label: Sequence alignment analysis (conservation)
description: Analyse character conservation in a molecular sequence alignment, for example to derive a consensus sequence.|Use this concept for methods that calculate substitution rates, estimate relative site variability, identify sites with biased properties, derive a consensus sequence, or identify highly conserved or very poorly conserved sites, regions, blocks etc.

label: Homology-based gene prediction
description: Prediction of genes or gene components by reference to homologous genes.

label: Read binning
description: An operation which groups reads or contigs and assigns them to operational taxonomic units.|Binning methods use one or a combination of compositional features or sequence similarity.

label: Indel detection
description: Identify insertion, deletion and duplication events from a sequence alignment.|Tools might use a genetic algorithm, quartet-mapping, bootscanning, graphical methods, random forest model and so on.

synonyms: Phylogenetic tree construction (from continuous quantitative characters)
label: Phylogenetic tree generation (from continuous quantitative characters)
description: Phylogenetic tree construction from continuous quantitative character data.

label: Sample comparison
description: The comparison of samples from a metagenomics study, for example, by comparison of metagenome shotgun reads or assembled contig sequences, by comparison of functional profiles, or some other method.

label: Protein-ligand docking
description: Model protein-ligand (for example protein-peptide) binding using comparative modelling or other techniques.|Methods aim to predict the position and orientation of a ligand bound to a protein receptor or enzyme.

label: Phasing
description: Phase a macromolecular crystal structure, for example by using molecular replacement or experimental phasing methods.

label: Sequence analysis
description: Analyse one or more known molecular sequences.

label: Nucleic acid structure analysis
description: Analyse nucleic acid tertiary structural data.

label: Sorting
description: Sort a set of files or data items according to some property.

label: Operon prediction
description: Find operons (operators, promoters and genes) in bacteria genes.

label: Indexing
description: Generate an index of (typically a file of) biological data.

label: Sequence motif discovery
description: Discover new motifs or conserved patterns in sequences or sequence alignments (de-novo discovery).|Motifs and patterns might be conserved or over-represented (occur with improbable frequency).

label: Nucleic acid folding analysis
description: Analyse some aspect of RNA/DNA folding, typically by processing sequence and/or structural data.  For example, compute folding energies such as minimum folding energies for DNA or RNA sequences or energy landscape of RNA mutants.

label: Protein subcellular localisation prediction
description: Predict the subcellular localisation of a protein sequence.|The prediction might include subcellular localisation (nuclear, cytoplasmic, mitochondrial, chloroplast, plastid, membrane etc) or export (extracellular proteins) of a protein.

label: Repeat sequence analysis
description: Find and/or analyse repeat sequences in (typically nucleotide) sequences.|Repeat sequences include tandem repeats, inverted or palindromic repeats, DNA microsatellites (Simple Sequence Repeats or SSRs), interspersed repeats, maximal duplications and reverse, complemented and reverse complemented repeats etc. Repeat units can be exact or imperfect, in tandem or dispersed, of specified or unspecified length.

label: Nucleic acid stitch profile plotting
description: Calculate and plot a DNA or DNA/RNA stitch profile.|A stitch profile represents the alternative conformations that partly melted DNA can adopt in a temperature range.

label: Structure alignment
description: Align (superimpose) molecular tertiary structures.

label: Sequence alignment analysis (site correlation)
description: Analyse correlations between sites in a molecular sequence alignment.|This is typically done to identify possible covarying positions and predict contacts or structural constraints in protein structures.

label: Sequence profile generation
description: Generate some type of sequence profile (for example a hidden Markov model) from a sequence alignment.

label: Splitting
description: Split a file containing multiple data items into many files, each containing one item

label: Protein domain recognition
description: Identify structural domains in a protein structure from first principles (for example calculations on structural compactness).

label: de Novo sequencing
description: Analytical process that derives a peptides amino acid sequence from its tandem mass spectrum (MS/MS) without the assistance of a sequence database.

label: Phylogenetic tree editing
description: Edit a phylogenetic tree.

label: SNP detection
description: Find single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) - single nucleotide change in base positions - between sequences. Typically done for sequences from a high-throughput sequencing experiment that differ from a reference genome and which might, especially by reference to population frequency or functional data, indicate a polymorphism.|This includes functional SNPs for large-scale genotyping purposes, disease-associated non-synonymous SNPs etc.

label: Primer and probe design
description: Predict oligonucleotide primers or probes.

label: Protein secondary structure comparison
description: Compare protein secondary structures.

label: k-mer counting
description: Count k-mers (substrings of length k) in DNA sequence data.|k-mer counting is used in genome and transcriptome assembly, metagenomic sequencing, and for error correction of sequence reads.

label: Protein contact map calculation
description: Calculate a residue contact map (typically all-versus-all inter-residue contacts) for a protein structure.

label: SNP annotation
description: Predict the effect or function of an individual single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP).

label: Protein property calculation
description: Extract, calculate or predict non-positional (physical or chemical) properties of a protein, including any non-positional properties of the molecular sequence, from processing a protein sequence or 3D structure.|This includes methods to render and visualise the properties of a protein sequence, and a residue-level search for properties such as solvent accessibility, hydropathy, secondary structure, ligand-binding etc.

label: ID mapping
description: Map data identifiers to one another for example to establish a link between two biological databases for the purposes of data integration.|The mapping can be achieved by comparing identifier values or some other means, e.g. exact matches to a provided sequence.

label: Structured RNA prediction and optimisation
description: Predict or optimise RNA sequences (sequence pools) with likely secondary and tertiary structure for in vitro selection.

label: Sequence coordinate conversion
description: Convert one set of sequence coordinates to another, e.g. convert coordinates of one assembly to another, cDNA to genomic, CDS to genomic, protein translation to genomic etc.

label: RNA secondary structure alignment
description: Align RNA secondary structures.

label: Protein function prediction
description: Predict general functional properties of a protein.|For functional properties that can be mapped to a sequence, use 'Sequence feature detection (protein)' instead.

label: S/MAR prediction
description: Identify matrix/scaffold attachment regions (MARs/SARs) in DNA sequences.|MAR/SAR sites often flank a gene or gene cluster and are found nearby cis-regulatory sequences. They might contribute to transcription regulation.

label: Labeled quantification
description: Quantification based on the use of chemical tags.

label: Genome visualisation
description: Visualise, format or render a nucleic acid sequence that is part of (and in context of) a complete genome sequence.

label: Sequence alignment
description: Align (identify equivalent sites within) molecular sequences.

label: Sequencing quality control
description: Raw sequence data quality control.|Analyse raw sequence data from a sequencing pipeline and identify (and possiby fix) problems.

label: Nucleic acid feature detection
description: Predict, recognise and identify features in nucleotide sequences such as functional sites or regions, typically by scanning for known motifs, patterns and regular expressions.|Methods typically involve scanning for known motifs, patterns and regular expressions.

label: RNA-seq time series data analysis
description: Analyze time series data from an RNA-seq experiment.

synonyms: PCR primer design (for large scale sequencing)
PCR primer design (for gene transcription profiling)
PCR primer design (based on gene structure)
label: PCR primer design
description: Design or predict oligonucleotide primers for PCR and DNA amplification etc.|Primer design involves predicting or selecting primers that are specific to a provided PCR template. Primers can be designed with certain properties such as size of product desired, primer size etc. The output might be a minimal or overlapping primer set.|This includes predicting primers based on gene structure, promoters, exon-exon junctions, predicting primers that are conserved across multiple genomes or species, primers for for gene transcription profiling,  for genotyping polymorphisms, for example single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs),  for large scale sequencing, or for methylation PCRs.

label: Phylogenetic tree analysis
description: Analyse an existing phylogenetic tree or trees, typically to detect features or make predictions.

label: Molecular model refinement
description: Refine (after evaluation) a model of a molecular structure (typically a protein structure) to reduce steric clashes, volume irregularities etc.

label: Bisulfite mapping
description: The mapping of methylation sites in a DNA (genome) sequence.|Bisulfite mapping follows high-throughput sequencing of DNA which has undergone bisulfite treatment followed by PCR amplification; unmethylated cytosines are specifically converted to thymine, allowing the methylation status of cytosine in the DNA to be detected.

label: Disulfide bond prediction
description: Predict cysteine bonding state and disulfide bond partners in protein sequences.

label: Sequence database search (by property)
