description: Search a sequence database and retrieve sequences with a specified property, typically a physicochemical or compositional property.

label: Read depth analysis
description: Analyse mapping density (read depth) of (typically) short reads from sequencing platforms, for example, to detect deletions and duplications.

label: Sequence motif analysis
description: Analyse molecular sequence motifs.

label: DNA transcription
description: Transcribe a nucleotide sequence into mRNA sequence(s).

label: Nucleic acid temperature profile plotting
description: Calculate and plot a DNA or DNA/RNA temperature profile.

label: Accessible surface calculation
description: Calculate solvent accessible or buried surface areas in protein or other molecular structures.|Solvent accessibility might be calculated for the backbone, sidechain and total (backbone plus sidechain).

label: Sequence contamination filtering
description: Identify and filter a (typically large) sequence data set to remove sequences from contaminants in the sample that was sequenced.

label: De-novo assembly
description: Sequence assembly by combining fragments without the aid of a reference sequence or genome.|De-novo assemblers are much slower and more memory intensive than mapping assemblers.

label: 3D-1D scoring matrix generation
description: Calculate a 3D-1D scoring matrix from analysis of protein sequence and structural data.|A 3D-1D scoring matrix scores the probability of amino acids occurring in different structural environments.

label: Sequence word comparison
description: Find exact character or word matches between molecular sequences without full sequence alignment.

label: Splice transcript prediction
description: Predict splicing alternatives or transcript isoforms from analysis of sequence data.

label: Protein quaternary structure prediction
description: Predict the structure of a multi-subunit protein and particularly how the subunits fit together.

label: Protein secondary structure prediction (helices)
description: Predict helical secondary structure of protein sequences.

label: Protein cleavage site prediction
description: Detect or predict cleavage sites (enzymatic or chemical) in protein sequences.

label: Epitope mapping
description: Predict antigenic determinant sites (epitopes) in protein sequences.|Epitope mapping is commonly done during vaccine design.

label: Phylogenetic tree comparison
description: Compare two or more phylogenetic trees.|For example, to produce a consensus tree, subtrees, supertrees, calculate distances between trees or test topological similarity between trees (e.g. a congruence index) etc.

label: Protein structure assignment
description: Assign a protein tertiary structure (3D coordinates), or other aspects of protein structure, from raw experimental data.

label: Article comparison
description: Compare two or more scientific articles.

label: Genetic code prediction
description: Predict genetic code from analysis of codon usage data.

label: microRNA detection
description: Identify or predict microRNA sequences (miRNA) and precursors or microRNA targets / binding sites in a DNA sequence.

label: Taxonomic classification
description: Classifiication (typically of molecular sequences) by assignment to some taxonomic hierarchy.

label: Sequence file editing
description: Perform basic (non-analytical) operations on a report or file of sequences (which might include features), such as file concatenation, removal or ordering of sequences, creation of subset or a new file of sequences.

label: Loading
description: Prepare or load a user-specified data file so that it is available for use.

label: Pathway or network analysis
description: Generate, process or analyse a biological pathway or network.

label: Mapping assembly
description: Sequence assembly by combining fragments using an existing backbone sequence, typically a reference genome.|The final sequence will resemble the backbone sequence. Mapping assemblers are usually much faster and less memory intensive than de-novo assemblers.

label: Operation
description: A function that processes a set of inputs and results in a set of outputs, or associates arguments (inputs) with values (outputs).|Special cases are: a) An operation that consumes no input (has no input arguments). Such operation is either a constant function, or an operation depending only on the underlying state. b) An operation that may modify the underlying state but has no output. c) The singular-case operation with no input or output, that still may modify the underlying state.

label: Transmembrane protein prediction
description: Predict and/or classify transmembrane proteins or transmembrane (helical) domains or regions in protein sequences.

label: Protein modelling (loops)
description: Model loop conformation in protein structures.

label: Differential binding analysis
description: Differential binding analysis identifies binding sites in nucleic acid sequences that are statistically significantly differentially bound between sample groups.

label: Database comparison
description: Compare the models or schemas used by two or more databases, or any other general comparison of databases rather than a detailed comparison of the entries themselves.

label: Phylogenetic tree generation (consensus)
description: Compare two or more phylogenetic trees to produce a consensus tree.|Methods typically test for topological similarity between trees using for example a congruence index.

label: Box-Whisker plot plotting
description: Generate a box plot, i.e. a depiction of groups of numerical data through their quartiles.

label: Ancestral reconstruction
description: The extrapolation of empirical characteristics of individuals or populations, backwards in time, to their common ancestors.|Ancestral reconstruction is often used to recover possible ancestral character states of ancient, extinct organisms.

label: Phylogenetic tree generation (minimum distance methods)
description: Construct a phylogenetic tree by computing (or using precomputed) distances between sequences and searching for the tree with minimal discrepancies between pairwise distances.|This includes neighbor joining (NJ) clustering method.

label: Structure classification
description: Assign molecular structure(s) to a group or category.

label: Protein function analysis
description: Analyse protein function, typically by processing protein sequence and/or structural data, and generate an informative report.

label: Dimethyl
description: Quantification analysis using chemical labeling by stable isotope dimethylation

label: Aggregation
description: Combine multiple files or data items into a single file or object.

label: Annotation
description: Annotate an entity (typically a biological or biomedical database entity) with terms from a controlled vocabulary.|This is a broad concept and is used a placeholder for other, more specific concepts.

label: Protein hydrophobic moment plotting
description: Calculate the hydrophobic moment of a peptide sequence and recognize amphiphilicity.|Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.

label: Rigid body refinement
description: A method used to refine a structure by moving the whole molecule or parts of it as a rigid unit, rather than moving individual atoms.|Rigid body refinement usually follows molecular replacement in the assignment of a structure from diffraction data.

label: Protein secondary structure analysis
description: Analyse protein secondary structure data.

label: Structure-based sequence alignment
description: Align molecular sequences using sequence and structural information.

label: Editing
description: Edit a data entity, either randomly or specifically.

label: Virtual PCR
description: Perform in-silico (virtual) PCR.

label: Recombination detection
description: Detect recombination (hotspots and coldspots) and identify recombination breakpoints in a sequence alignment.|Tools might use a genetic algorithm, quartet-mapping, bootscanning, graphical methods, random forest model and so on.

label: Restriction map drawing
description: Draw or visualise restriction maps in DNA sequences.

label: Residue distance calculation
description: Calculate contacts between residues, or between residues and other groups, in a protein structure, on the basis of distance calculations.|This includes identifying HET groups, which usually correspond to ligands, lipids, but might also (not consistently) include groups that are attached to amino acids. Each HET group is supposed to have a unique three letter code and a unique name which might be given in the output.  It can also include calculation of symmetry contacts, i.e. a contact between two atoms in different asymmetric unit.

label: Species frequency estimation
description: Estimate the frequencies of different species from analysis of the molecular sequences, typically of DNA recovered from environmental samples.

label: Sequence mutation and randomisation
description: Mutate a molecular sequence a specified amount or shuffle it to produce a randomised sequence with the same overall composition.

label: Sequence redundancy removal
description: Compare two or more molecular sequences, identify and remove redundant sequences based on some criteria.

label: Genotyping
description: Analyse DNA sequence data to identify differences between the genetic composition (genotype) of an individual compared to other individual's or a reference sequence.|Methods might consider cytogenetic analyses, copy number polymorphism (and calculate copy number calls for copy-number variation(CNV) regions), single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP), , rare copy number variation (CNV) identification, loss of heterozygosity data and so on.

label: Sequence alignment validation
description: Evaluate molecular sequence alignment accuracy.|Evaluation might be purely sequence-based or use structural information.

label: Linkage analysis
description: Analyse genetic linkage.|For example, estimate how close two genes are on a chromosome by calculating how often they are transmitted together to an offspring, ascertain whether two genes are linked and parental linkage, calculate linkage map distance etc.

label: MRM/SRM
description: Quantification by Selected/multiple Reaction Monitoring workflow (XIC quantitation of precursor / fragment mass pair).

label: Protein quantification
description: Technique for determining the amount of proteins in a sample.

label: Statistical modelling
description: Construction of a statistical model, or a set of assumptions around some observed data, usually by describing a set of probability distributions which approximate the distribution of data.

label: Spectral analysis
description: Analyse one or more spectra from mass spectrometry (or other) experiments.

synonyms: Phylogenetic tree-based multiple sequence alignment construction
label: Tree-based sequence alignment
description: Align multiple sequences using relative gap costs calculated from neighbors in a supplied phylogenetic tree.|This is supposed to give a more biologically meaningful alignment than standard alignments.

label: Multiple structure alignment
description: Align (superimpose) more than two molecular tertiary structures.|This includes methods that use an existing alignment.

label: Multiple sample visualisation
description: Visualise, format or render data arising from an analysis of multiple samples from a metagenomics/community experiment.

label: Variant classification
description: Classify variants based on their potential effect on genes, especially functional effects on the expressed proteins.|Variants are typically classified by their position (intronic, exonic, etc.) in a gene transcript and (for variants in coding exons) by their effect on the protein sequence (synonymous, non-synonymous, frameshifting, etc.)

label: Phylogenetic tree generation (method centric)
description: Construct a phylogenetic tree using a specific method.

label: DNA translation
description: Translate a DNA sequence into protein.

label: Protein folding analysis
description: Analyse, simulate or predict protein folding, typically by processing sequence and / or structural data.  For example, predict sites of nucleation or stabilisation key to protein folding.

label: Frameshift detection
description: Detect frameshifts in DNA sequences, including frameshift sites and signals, and frameshift errors from sequencing projects.|Methods include sequence alignment (if related sequences are available) and word-based sequence comparison.

label: Data handling
description: Basic (non-analytical) operations of some data, either a file or equivalent entity in memory, such that the same basic type of data is consumed as input and generated as output.

label: Metal-bound cysteine detection
description: Detect cysteines that are bound to metal in a protein structure.

label: Protein dipole moment calculation
description: Calculate whether a protein structure has an unusually large net charge (dipole moment).

label: Protein interaction network analysis
description: Analyse a network of protein interactions.

label: Antimicrobial resistance prediction
description: Identify or predict causes for antibiotic resistance from molecular sequence analysis.

label: Residue cluster calculation
description: Calculate clusters of contacting residues in protein structures.|This includes for example clusters of hydrophobic or charged residues, or clusters of contacting residues which have a key structural or functional role.

label: Codon usage bias calculation
description: Calculate codon usage bias.

label: Gene expression profiling
description: The measurement of the gene expression of multiple genes in a cell, tissue, sample etc., in order to get an impression of biological function.|Metagenomic inference is the profiling of phylogenetic marker genes in order to predict metagenome function.|Gene expression profiling generates some sort of gene expression profile, for example from microarray data.

label: Proximity map plotting
description: Generate a plot of distances (distance or correlation matrix) between expression values.

label: Sequence complexity calculation
description: Calculate sequence complexity, for example to find low-complexity regions in sequences.

label: Chemical redundancy removal
description: Identify and remove redudancy from a set of small molecule structures.

label: Protein secondary structure prediction
description: Predict secondary structure of protein sequences.|Methods might use amino acid composition, local sequence information, multiple sequence alignments, physicochemical features, estimated energy content, statistical algorithms, hidden Markov models, support vector machines, kernel machines, neural networks etc.

label: Genome alignment
description: Align two or more (tpyically huge) molecular sequences that represent genomes.

label: Sequence generation
description: Generate a molecular sequence by some means.

label: Surface rendering
description: Calculate the positions of dots that are homogeneously distributed over the surface of a molecule.|A dot has three coordinates (x,y,z) and (typically) a color.

label: Nucleic acid curvature calculation
description: Calculate curvature and flexibility / stiffness of a nucleotide sequence.|This includes properties such as.

label: Nucleic acid melting curve plotting
description: Calculate and plot a DNA or DNA/RNA melting curve.

label: Transmembrane protein visualisation
description: Visualise transmembrane proteins, typically the transmembrane regions within a sequence.

label: Structural similarity search
description: Search a database of molecular structure and retrieve structures that are similar to a query structure.

label: Phylogenetic species tree construction
description: Construct a phylogenetic species tree, for example, from a genome-wide sequence comparison.

label: Probabilistic sequence generation
description: Generate sequences from some probabilistic model, e.g. a model that simulates evolution.

label: Image analysis
description: The analysis of a image (typically a digital image) of some type in order to extract information from it.

label: Transposon prediction
description: Detect or predict transposons, retrotransposons / retrotransposition signatures etc.

label: Pairwise structure alignment
description: Align (superimpose) exactly two molecular tertiary structures.

label: Protein structural motif recognition
description: Identify or screen for 3D structural motifs in protein structure(s).|This includes conserved substructures and conserved geometry, such as spatial arrangement of secondary structure or protein backbone. Methods might use structure alignment, structural templates, searches for similar electrostatic potential and molecular surface shape, surface-mapping of phylogenetic information etc.

label: Phylogenetic tree generation (from polymorphism data)
description: Phylogenetic tree construction from polymorphism data including microsatellites, RFLP (restriction fragment length polymorphisms), RAPD (random-amplified polymorphic DNA) and AFLP (amplified fragment length polymorphisms) data.

label: Design
description: Design a biological entity (typically a molecular sequence or structure) with specific properties.

label: Protein modelling (side chains)
description: Model, analyse or edit amino acid side chain conformation in protein structure, optimize side-chain packing, hydrogen bonding etc.|Methods might use a residue rotamer library.

label: Sequence trimming
description:
Cut (remove) the end from a molecular sequence.|This includes



ennd trimming

Trim sequences (typically from an automated DNA sequencer) to remove misleading ends.

For example trim polyA tails, introns and primer sequence flanking the sequence of amplified exons, or other unwanted sequence.



trimming to a reference sequence, 

Trim sequences (typically from an automated DNA sequencer) to remove the sequence ends that extend beyond an assembled reference sequence.



vector trimming

Trim sequences (typically from an automated DNA sequencer) to remove sequence-specific end regions, typically contamination from vector sequences.

label: Exome assembly
description: Analyse sequencing data from experiments aiming to selectively sequence the coding regions of the genome.

label: Variant prioritisation
description: Identify biologically interesting variants by prioritizing individual variants, for example, homozygous variants absent in control genomes.|Variant prioritisation can be used for example to produce a list of variants responsible for 'knocking out' genes in specific genomes. Methods amino acid substitution, aggregative approaches, probabilistic approach, inheritance and unified likelihood-frameworks.

label: Structure comparison
description: Compare two or more molecular tertiary structures.
